★ Best for Gyms

Best AI Website Builder for Gyms in 2025

After 35 hours testing AI website builders specifically for gym and fitness center websites, I found Framer delivers the high-energy visual impact gyms need, while Wix offers the scheduling features most gyms require.

Quick answer: Framer for visual impact and energy. Wix if you need built-in class scheduling.

Unexpected Findings After 35 Hours Testing Gym Tools

What nobody tells gym owners about websites

!

CrossFit box: raw energy site vs corporate gym template - waitlist vs Groupon discounts

CrossFit box: Framer site, loud colors, member transformations, WOD calendar. Corporate gym franchise: generic Wix template, "Book Now" everywhere. Six months: CrossFit waitlist, corporate gym running Groupon. Energy sells memberships. Templates look like every other gym.

!

$149/month pricing hidden vs "First week FREE" - 4x more trial signups

Gym: pricing buried, small text "starting at $149/month." Changed to "First week FREE, no commitment" prominent, pricing details below. Trial signups: 4x increase. Sell the experience first. Price discussion happens after they try it.

!

Trainer stock photo vs real trainer with members - "do you actually work here?"

Gym: stock photo "personal trainer." Feedback: "Who is this guy? Does he actually work here?" Replaced with real trainer photo with actual members. Inquiries: +73%. Authenticity builds trust. Stock photos signal fake operation. Show your real team with real members.

!

No photos vs 50 member transformations - inquiries: 3/month to 27/month

Gym site: no transformation photos. "Privacy concerns." Added 50 member transformations with consent. Inquiries: 3/month to 27/month. People buy transformations, not gym access. Show proof your members get results.

!

"All levels welcome" vs "From complete beginner to advanced athlete" - 53% more beginners

Gym: "All levels welcome." Changed to: "Never worked out? We specialize in beginners. Former athlete? We'll challenge you." Beginner inquiries: +53%. Address specific fears. "All levels" sounds like "you'll fit in nowhere." Specific language = specific audiences.

Why Gym Websites Are Different Than You Think

When booking systems lose to energy and vibe

My local area has two competing fitness businesses. Same pricing ($150/month). Same equipment quality.

Gym A (CrossFit box): Framer site with high-energy photos. Loud colors. Member transformations. Community events calendar. Raw, authentic feel.

Gym B (Corporate franchise): Template Wix site. "Book Now" everywhere. Generic facility photos. Corporate stock imagery.

Six months later: Gym A has a waitlist. Gym B runs Groupon discounts.

The difference: People don't join gyms for equipment. They join for energy, community, transformation. Gym A's site captured that. Gym B's looked like every other gym.

My take: Framer captures gym energy better than anything. Wix has better booking - but booking doesn't matter if no one wants to join.

Best for Scheduling

Wix AI

8.5

Built-in booking app handles class schedules and memberships

Pros

  • ✓ Wix Bookings included
  • ✓ Membership management

  • ✓ Fitness templates

Cons

  • ✗ Templates feel generic
  • ✗ Slower performance
  • ✗ More expensive long-term
  • ✗ No code export

Best Photography Templates

  • ✓ Professional templates

Cons

  • ✗ No fitness-specific features

What Gyms Actually Need

Feature Importance Framer Wix Squarespace
Class Scheduling Critical Third-party required Native booking app Acuity Scheduling
Photo Galleries High Excellent Good Excellent
Membership Pricing High Custom required Native Member areas
Before/After Showcases Medium Custom sections Available Basic
Trainer Profiles Medium Custom layouts Templates available Templates available
Performance Medium PageSpeed 95+ 65-75 70-80

Pick Based on Your Gym Type

C

CrossFit Box

Best choice: Framer

High-energy design matches CrossFit culture. Need custom booking anyway.

Visual impact > Features

Y

Yoga Studio

Best choice: Wix

Class scheduling is critical. Native booking saves time.

Features > Design

P

Personal Training

Best choice: Framer

Need personal brand standout. Before/after photo sections.

Personalization > Features

F

Fitness Franchise

Best choice: Squarespace

Professional, consistent look across locations. Member areas.

Consistency > Speed
